Night Shift and Rat Trap nodd, as they do as they're told. They could also =
see that Tucson appeared to be losing his patience with Cheetor, but was tr=
ying hard not to.

Night Shift looks to Rat Trap.

"We better go'n get that=
 work done.  They'll need the CR chamber stabilized 'n ready ta go ASAP."

=
Rat Trap nodds back.

"You're right, let's go.  Besides, I think Wheels loo=
ks about ready ta lose his temper..."

They retreat into the CR chamber are=
a.  Tucson's brow narrows yet not much on the line of words comes out right=
 away.

" Must we always assume the worst Cheetor?  Must we always follow a=
 similar path even if it may lead us over a cliff to our demise?  Talon is =
right, Perceptor risked his own life so that we may still remain functionab=
le.  If he were to turn his back on us, he would have done that vorns ago. =
 Now, I will not hear another negative word about Perceptor.  Not in my pre=
ssence.  He has risked his life for us, and now we must do him the respect =
of showing him our thanks for his efforts.  Now, enough bickering, we have =
a tunnel to seal off and Rodimus Prime to bring back online.  I'm sure he w=
ouldn't want to see any of you bickering either.  Am I understood Cheetor?"=


His voice as deep as Optimus Prime's, Tucson Prime speaks his word assert=
ively without being aggressive.

Quickstride watches things unfold.

"Wow, =
ya know Lord Elder, he may not be able ta see, but he sure knows his words =
of wisdom.  Definitely what Optimus Prime would've done."
